intro: Didissandra kiewii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in umbels, and it produces elliptical, yellowish fruits that contain seeds. Didissandra kiewii is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
